title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 May 2017 - XWiki
content:
<simfir> has quit  
05:05 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:08 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
05:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <VincentMassol[m]> good morning everyone  
07:12 <VincentMassol[m]> BTW this doesn't look very nice: https://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa#Created-vs-Resolved-Chart/13643  
07:13 <VincentMassol[m]> seems bugs are winning at the moment :)  
07:13 <ClmentAubin[m]> Ahoy !  
07:13 <VincentMassol[m]> hi caubin  
08:18 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <VincentMassol[m]> btw we're getting some spam attacks on some wikis on myxwiki.org  
11:05 <VincentMassol[m]> in term of user registration  
11:06 <VincentMassol[m]> (spam user registration that is)  
11:06 <VincentMassol[m]> we get plenty of user creation, for ex: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/HaroldThota  
11:06 <VincentMassol[m]> I'll run my cleaning script  
11:15 <tmortagne[m]> does not looks like the usual spam users  
11:15 <tmortagne[m]> there was no captcha to register, I enabled it  
11:16 <VincentMassol[m]> It's running  
11:16 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm deleting about 80 spam accounts  
11:16 <VincentMassol[m]> ah ok thanks for the captcha  
11:16 <VincentMassol[m]> there was a mix of obvious spam users  
11:16 <VincentMassol[m]> such as: XWiki.qSgXDNhtW0 - qSgXDNhtW0  
11:17 <VincentMassol[m]> and others like XWiki.Williamwef - Williamwef  
11:17 <VincentMassol[m]> any my script removes accounts that have first name = last name  
11:17 <VincentMassol[m]> we're taking a small risk ofc  
11:18 <VincentMassol[m]> but that should be ok and if someone cannot connect they'll hopefully contact us  
11:23 <keks[m]> you could mark them and make them enter a captcha once after next login  
11:25 <VincentMassol[m]> keks: yep, good idea, the feature would need to be developed first :) Could be interesting to log as an idea in jira  
11:45 <zzeroo> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <pbondoerffer[m]> hi, i've got a fix for XWIKI-10122 and i'd like to contibute it, does that mean i have to clone/fork the entire xwiki-platform repository?  
11:48 <VincentMassol[m]> pbondoerffer: I think so yes  
11:48 <pbondoerffer[m]> that is a lot of commits ^^;  
11:52 <VincentMassol[m]> yes but that's how git works  
11:53 <VincentMassol[m]> in svn you can checkout only some part of the path  
11:53 <VincentMassol[m]> you could try to do some sparse checkout with git  
11:53 <VincentMassol[m]> but it's not the default  
11:54 <tmortagne[m]> pbondoerffer: yes in git it's all or nothing  
11:54 <tmortagne[m]> (that's why it's so fast locally)  
11:56 <pbondoerffer[m]> ill just clone the entire repository, im just a bit worried about disk space  
11:58 <tmortagne[m]> pbondoerffer: 2.7G on my side but I have a lot of built binaries in it  
11:59 <pbondoerffer[m]> its 300mb source only  
12:00 <pbondoerffer[m]> just finished cloning, that took a while  
12:00 <tmortagne[m]> the .git yes  
12:00 <tmortagne[m]> and it's that git for history reason: we used to have lots of jar in it before Maven  
12:00 <pbondoerffer[m]> 437M according to du  
12:00 <tmortagne[m]> s/git/big/  
12:01 <tmortagne[m]> and all those jars are still stored in the history  
12:01 <pbondoerffer[m]> yeah i guessed so  
12:01 \* pbondoerffer[m] sent a long message: pbondoerffer[m]\_2017-05-03\_10:01:23.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/oplHpCwvauVXjHUjJMrGypYe  
12:59 <SebMel> has joined #xwiki  
13:01 <SebMel> Hi, i just did a fresh xwiki installation (9.3.1) on debian, but it shows me stuff like "xwiki.jsfx.use('js/prototype/prototype.js'" printed on the page. Any idea why that could be happening?  
13:05 <SebMel> also there is no error in the logs  
13:15 <tmortagne[m]> SebMel: a screenshot could be nice because I don't understand what you mean exactly  
13:24 <SebMel> sorry, i think i found my mistake i installed xwiki-common instead of xwiki-enterprise-common  
13:24 <SebMel> with xwiki-enterprise-common it works :)  
13:25 <tmortagne[m]> you setup the applocation server and the database yourself ?  
13:25 <SebMel> no, i also added xwiki-tomcat7-mysql  but, still  
13:25 <tmortagne[m]> there should not be much difference between xwiki-enterprise-common and xwiki-common  
13:25 <SebMel> the skin extension seems to be missing in that case  
13:26 <tmortagne[m]> ok  
13:26 <tmortagne[m]> hmm  
13:26 <tmortagne[m]> install xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql then not xwiki-tomcat7-mysql  
13:26 <tmortagne[m]> will look at what is wrong with xwiki-common  
13:27 <tmortagne[m]> it's not used much yet  
13:27 <tmortagne[m]> but will become more important in shortly  
13:28 <SebMel> ok, well that is what i did now and it works, thanks for your help  
13:35 <tmortagne[m]> SebMel: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT for more  
13:48 <SebMel> has quit  
14:19 <pbondoerffer[m]> hi, im working on livetable and need to add two javascript libraries (daterangepicker and momentjs), it is my understanding that we use webjars to accomplish this. i understand how to add them, but im not sure where they go  
14:19 <VincentMassol[m]> Enygma: is this issue fixed http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/MichaelZhang ? (see the $msg.get() messages displayed)  
14:50 <msmeria> has quit  
15:12 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <floflobel> has quit  
15:44 <Enygma`> vmassol: "$msg.get("xe.xwiki.space") / Default Class Sheet" leads to http://curriki.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiRights (which prompts DW). The issue I see here is that the page title of XWIki.WebHome inside the "curriki" wiki is using a deprecated/removed translation key. Seeing DW hints that it was not really migrated and Solr probably has it still indexed.  
15:45 <Enygma`> so it`s more of a data/configuration issue  
15:45 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm how come we have curriki indexed on xwiki.org? We should probably remove that  
15:45 <Enygma`> (solr indexes it in the results, but the actual breadcrumb/location display is done live)  
15:45 <tmortagne[m]> we should remove curriki for sure :)  
15:46 <VincentMassol[m]> I'mpretty sure I did that in the past though, strange  
15:48 <tmortagne[m]> it's redirected to xclams but the wiki exist  
15:52 <VincentMassol[m]> need to remember where it's configured...  
15:53 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: any idea?  
15:53 <VincentMassol[m]> I don't see anything on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/Search?editor=wiki  
15:53 <VincentMassol[m]> ah maybe SolrSearch  
15:53 <VincentMassol[m]> ok found it  
15:53 <VincentMassol[m]> XWikiOrg.SolrSearchConfig  
15:54 <VincentMassol[m]> so it shouldn't be indexed!  
15:54 <VincentMassol[m]> #set ($wikisSearchableFromMainWiki = ['xwiki', 'platform', 'enterprise', 'manager', 'extensions', 'dev', 'contrib', 'commons', 'rendering', 'snippets'])  
15:54 <VincentMassol[m]> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWikiOrg/SolrSearchConfig?editor=wiki  
15:54 <mflorea[m]> that's different, that controls where to search, not what gets indexed  
15:55 <tmortagne[m]> there is no configuration for the indexer  
15:55 <mflorea[m]> yes, everything is indexed  
15:55 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm indeed...  that's missing  
15:55 <tmortagne[m]> everything is indexed  
15:55 <VincentMassol[m]> would be nice to have a config for that  
15:55 <tmortagne[m]> the best would be to simply archive curriki wiki, it's not accessible anymore anyway  
15:56 <VincentMassol[m]> yes but it's ,not the only wiki  
15:56 <VincentMassol[m]> we don't want indexed  
15:56 <VincentMassol[m]> for ex playgroundtemplate shouldn't either  
15:59 <keks[m]> pbondoerffer, tmortagne (@tmortagne:matrix.xwiki.com): `git clone --depth=1`  
15:59 <tmortagne[m]> keks: this has no effect on the history  
15:59 <keks[m]> it doesn't clone it, right?  
16:00 <VincentMassol[m]> created https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14250  
16:00 <keks[m]> I thought you were talking about not fetching the history on clone, sorry :)  
16:00 <tmortagne[m]> not really I don't remember what it does exactly but I already looked at it some time ago  
16:01 <keks[m]> "Create a shallow clone with a history truncated to the specified number of commits."  
16:02 <tmortagne[m]> it's possible the issue was that you could not really push after that or something like this  
16:02 <keks[m]> true  
16:03 <keks[m]> but if you only want to build, this is great. i mean, if you want to work on the code, you will also want the history imho  
16:03 <tmortagne[m]> the point here was to contribute something to a github fork  
16:04 <keks[m]> ohhh i see  
16:04 <tmortagne[m]> pbondoerffer did not want to have to clone the whole platform just for this  
16:04 <keks[m]> yeah in that case i figure it's not possible  
16:06 <VincentMassol[m]> it's possible with some filter branch but not very convenient  
16:20 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: when you have some time I'd like to have your opinion on https://gist.github.com/vmassol/c210207f36d948bbf24e2994ba220d8f  
17:06 <mflorea[m]> vmassol: I commented  
17:14 <VincentMassol[m]> thanks, I commented back  
17:29 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
17:31 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
20:07 <evalica> has quit  
20:46 <Slashman> has quit  
20:46 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
21:37 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki
